sentences.zh: 自古受命帝王，曷嘗不封禪？

translations.literal: From ancient times, emperors and kings who received the mandate, how have they ever not performed feng and shan?
translations.idiomatic: Since ancient times, what emperor or king who received the mandate has not performed feng and shan?

sentences.zh: 蓋有無其應而用事者矣，未有睹符瑞見而不臻乎泰山者也。

translations.literal: There have indeed been those who performed the rituals without their proper omens, but there have never been those who saw auspicious signs appear yet did not proceed to Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: There have been those who performed the rituals without the proper omens, but there have never been those who saw auspicious signs appear yet did not proceed to Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 雖受命而功不至，至梁父矣而德不洽，洽矣而日有不暇給，是以即事用希。

translations.literal: Though received mandate yet merit not reach, reached Liang Fu already yet virtue not harmonious, harmonious already yet days have not sufficient, therefore approach affairs use rare.
translations.idiomatic: Even though they received the mandate, if their merit was not sufficient, or having arrived at Liang Fu their virtue was not pervasive, or it was pervasive but their days were insufficient, therefore they rarely performed the rituals.

sentences.zh: 傳曰：「三年不為禮，禮必廢；

translations.literal: Tradition says: 'Three years not do rites, rites certainly waste;'
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says: 'If for three years one does not perform the rites, the rites will certainly be abandoned;'

sentences.zh: 三年不為樂，樂必壞。」

translations.literal: Three years not do music, music certainly bad.'
translations.idiomatic: If for three years one does not make music, the music will certainly decay.'

sentences.zh: 每世之隆，則封禪答焉，及衰而息。

translations.literal: Every generation's prosperity, then feng shan respond there, reach decline then rest.
translations.idiomatic: In every flourishing age, feng and shan are performed in response; when it declines, they cease.

sentences.zh: 厥曠遠者千有餘載，近者數百載，故其儀闕然堙滅，其詳不可得而記聞云。

translations.literal: Their distant ones thousand have remaining years, near ones several hundred years, therefore their rites lacking completely extinguished, their details cannot obtained and record heard say.
translations.idiomatic: The distant ones are more than a thousand years ago, the recent ones several hundred years ago, therefore their rituals are completely lost and extinguished, and the details cannot be recorded or heard.

sentences.zh: 《尚書》曰，舜在璇璣玉衡，以齊七政。

translations.literal: Shang Shu says: Shun at Xuan Ji Yu Heng, with align seven governances.
translations.idiomatic: The Shang Shu says: Shun was at the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng to align the seven governances.

sentences.zh: 遂類于上帝，禋于六宗，望山川，遍群神。

translations.literal: Then sacrifice to Supreme God, offer to Six Ancestors, look at mountains rivers, extensively various spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Then he offered sacrifice to the Supreme God, made offerings to the Six Honored Ones, gazed at mountains and rivers, and universally honored the various spirits.

sentences.zh: 輯五瑞，擇吉月日，見四嶽諸牧，還瑞。

translations.literal: Gather five auspicious objects, select lucky months days, see four peaks various shepherds, return auspicious objects.
translations.idiomatic: He gathered the five tokens of virtue, chose auspicious months and days, met with the lords of the four peaks and the various shepherds, and returned the tokens.

sentences.zh: 歲二月，東巡狩，至于岱宗。

translations.literal: Year second month, east inspect hunt, arrive at Dai Zong.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of the year, he toured the east, arriving at Dai Zong.

sentences.zh: 岱宗，泰山也。

translations.literal: Dai Zong, Mount Tai also.
translations.idiomatic: Dai Zong is Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 柴，望秩于山川。

translations.literal: Burnt offering, look at arrange mountains rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He made burnt offerings, gazing and arranging the mountains and rivers.

sentences.zh: 遂覲東后。

translations.literal: Then audience Eastern Lords.
translations.idiomatic: Then he had an audience with the Eastern Lords.

sentences.zh: 東后者，諸侯也。

translations.literal: Eastern Lords, feudal lords also.
translations.idiomatic: The Eastern Lords are the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 合時月正日，同律度量衡，修五禮，五玉三帛二生一死贄。

translations.literal: Unite seasons months correct days, same pitch pipes measures weights, repair five rites, five jades three silks two living one dead offerings.
translations.idiomatic: He unified the seasons, months, and first days; standardized pitch pipes, measures, and weights; repaired the five rites; five jades, three silks, two living and one dead offerings.

sentences.zh: 五月，巡狩至南嶽。

translations.literal: Fifth month, inspect hunt arrive Southern Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he toured and arrived at the Southern Peak.

sentences.zh: 南嶽，衡山也。

translations.literal: Southern Peak, Mount Heng also.
translations.idiomatic: The Southern Peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 八月，巡狩至西嶽。

translations.literal: Eighth month, inspect hunt arrive Western Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he toured and arrived at the Western Peak.

sentences.zh: 西嶽，華山也。

translations.literal: Western Peak, Mount Hua also.
translations.idiomatic: The Western Peak is Mount Hua.

sentences.zh: 十一月，巡狩至北嶽。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, inspect hunt arrive Northern Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he toured and arrived at the Northern Peak.

sentences.zh: 北岳，恒山也。

translations.literal: Northern Peak, Mount Heng also.
translations.idiomatic: The Northern Peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 皆如岱宗之禮。

translations.literal: All like Dai Zong rites.
translations.idiomatic: All were like the rites at Dai Zong.

sentences.zh: 中嶽，嵩高也。

translations.literal: Central Peak, Song Gao also.
translations.idiomatic: The Central Peak is Song Gao.

sentences.zh: 五載一巡狩。

translations.literal: Five years one inspect hunt.
translations.idiomatic: Every five years one imperial tour.

sentences.zh: 禹遵之。

translations.literal: Yu follow it.
translations.idiomatic: Yu followed this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，至帝孔甲，淫德好神，神瀆，二龍去之。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, arrive Emperor Kong Jia, licentious virtue fond spirits, spirits profane, two dragons leave him.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen generations later, to Emperor Kong Jia, whose virtue was licentious and who favored spirits; the spirits were defiled, and two dragons left him.

sentences.zh: 其後三世，湯伐桀，欲遷夏社，不可，作夏社。

translations.literal: Its after three generations, Tang attack Jie, wish move Xia altar, not possible, make Xia altar.
translations.idiomatic: After three more generations, Tang attacked Jie; he wished to move the Xia altar but could not, so he made a Xia altar.

sentences.zh: 後八世，至帝太戊，有桑谷生於廷，一暮大拱，懼。

translations.literal: After eight generations, arrive Emperor Tai Wu, have mulberry millet grow in courtyard, one evening large embrace, fear.
translations.idiomatic: Eight generations later, to Emperor Tai Wu, there was a mulberry tree that grew in the courtyard; in one evening it became large enough to embrace, and he was afraid.

sentences.zh: 伊陟曰：「妖不勝德。」

translations.literal: Yi Zhi say: 'Monsters not overcome virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi said: 'Monsters cannot overcome virtue.'

sentences.zh: 太戊修德，桑谷死。

translations.literal: Tai Wu cultivate virtue, mulberry millet die.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry millet died.

sentences.zh: 伊陟贊巫咸，巫咸之興自此始。

translations.literal: Yi Zhi assist Wu Xian, Wu Xian's rise from this begin.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，帝武丁得傅說為相，殷復興焉，稱高宗。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, Emperor Wu Ding obtain Fu Yue as chancellor, Yin revive there, call Gao Zong.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as chancellor, Yin revived, and he was called Gao Zong.

sentences.zh: 有雉登鼎耳雊，武丁懼。

translations.literal: Have pheasant climb cauldron ear crow, Wu Ding fear.
translations.idiomatic: A pheasant climbed onto the cauldron's ear and crowed; Wu Ding was afraid.

sentences.zh: 祖己曰：「修德。」

translations.literal: Zu Ji say: 'Cultivate virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.'

sentences.zh: 武丁從之，位以永寧。

translations.literal: Wu Ding follow it, position with eternal peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position achieved eternal peace.

sentences.zh: 後五世，帝武乙慢神而震死。

translations.literal: After five generations, Emperor Wu Yi disrespect spirits and thunder die.
translations.idiomatic: Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi was disrespectful to the spirits and died struck by lightning.

sentences.zh: 後三世，帝紂淫亂，武王伐之。

translations.literal: After three generations, Emperor Zhou licentious disorder, Wu Wang attack him.
translations.idiomatic: Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was licentious and disorderly, so King Wu attacked him.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，始未嘗不肅祗，後稍怠慢也。

translations.literal: From this observe, beginning never not reverent respectful, after gradually negligent also.
translations.idiomatic: From this we can see that at first they were never not reverent and respectful, but later they gradually became negligent.

sentences.zh: 周官曰，冬日至，祀天於南郊，迎長日之至；

translations.literal: Zhou officials say: winter solstice arrive, sacrifice heaven at southern suburb, welcome long day arrive;
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou officials say: when the winter solstice arrives, sacrifice to heaven at the southern suburb, welcoming the arrival of longer days;

sentences.zh: 夏日至，祭地祗。

translations.literal: Summer solstice arrive, sacrifice earth spirits.
translations.idiomatic: When the summer solstice arrives, sacrifice to the earth spirits.

sentences.zh: 皆用樂舞，而神乃可得而禮也。

translations.literal: All use music dance, and spirits then can obtain and ritual also.
translations.idiomatic: All use music and dance, and then the spirits can be obtained and honored.

sentences.zh: 天子祭天下名山大川，五嶽視三公，四瀆視諸侯，諸侯祭其疆內名山大川。

translations.literal: Emperor sacrifice all under heaven famous mountains great rivers, five peaks regard three dukes, four rivers regard feudal lords, feudal lords sacrifice their territory within famous mountains great rivers.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor sacrifices to all the famous mountains and great rivers under heaven; the five peaks are treated like the three dukes, the four rivers like the feudal lords; the feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories.

sentences.zh: 四瀆者，江、河、淮、濟也。

translations.literal: Four rivers, Jiang, He, Huai, Ji also.
translations.idiomatic: The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji.

sentences.zh: 天子曰明堂、辟雍，諸侯曰泮宮。

translations.literal: Emperor call Bright Hall, Pi Yong, feudal lords call Pan Palace.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.

sentences.zh: 周公既相成王，郊祀后稷以配天，宗祀文王於明堂以配上帝。

translations.literal: Zhou Gong already chancellor Cheng Wang, suburban sacrifice Hou Ji to match heaven, ancestral sacrifice Wen Wang at Bright Hall to match Supreme God.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou, having become chancellor to King Cheng, performed suburban sacrifices to Hou Ji to match heaven, and ancestral sacrifices to King Wen in the Bright Hall to match the Supreme God.

sentences.zh: 自禹興而修社祀，后稷稼穡，故有稷祠，郊社所從來尚矣。

translations.literal: From Yu rise and repair altar sacrifices, Hou Ji plow harvest, therefore have Ji sacrifices, suburban altar what from come ancient already.
translations.idiomatic: Since Yu rose and repaired the altar sacrifices, Hou Ji plowed and harvested, therefore there are Ji sacrifices; the suburban and altar sacrifices have come from ancient times.

sentences.zh: 自周克殷後十四世，世益衰，禮樂廢，諸侯恣行，而幽王為犬戎所敗，周東徙雒邑。

translations.literal: From Zhou conquer Yin after fourteen generations, generations increasingly decline, rites music abandon, feudal lords wantonly act, and You Wang by Quanrong defeated, Zhou east move Luo yi.
translations.idiomatic: Since Zhou conquered Yin, after fourteen generations, the generations increasingly declined, rites and music were abandoned, the feudal lords acted wantonly, and King You was defeated by the Quanrong, Zhou moved east to Luo yi.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公攻戎救周，始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong attack Rong save Zhou, begin ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Xiang Gong attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began being ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公既侯，居西垂，自以為主少皞之神，作西畤，祠白帝，其牲用騮駒黃牛羝羊各一云。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong already marquis, dwell west border, self consider master Shao Hao god, make west altar, sacrifice White Emperor, his victims use sorrel colt yellow ox ram sheep each one say.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Xiang Gong, having become a marquis, dwelt in the western border, considering himself master of Shao Hao's god, made the Western Altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using sorrel colts, yellow oxen, and rams as victims, each one, they say.

sentences.zh: 其後十六年，秦文公東獵汧渭之閒，卜居之而吉。

translations.literal: Its after sixteen years, Qin Wen Gong east hunt Qian Wei between, divine dwell it and auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Sixteen years later, Qin Wen Gong hunted east between the Qian and Wei, divined dwelling there and it was auspicious.

sentences.zh: 文公夢黃蛇自天下屬地，其口止於鄜衍。

translations.literal: Wen Gong dream yellow snake from heaven reach earth, its mouth stop at Fu Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan.

sentences.zh: 文公問史敦，敦曰：「此上帝之徵，君其祠之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong ask Shi Dun, Dun say: 'This Supreme God sign, lord should sacrifice it.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is a sign from the Supreme God; my lord should sacrifice to it.'

sentences.zh: 於是作鄜畤，用三牲郊祭白帝焉。

translations.literal: Therefore make Fu altar, use three victims suburban sacrifice White Emperor there.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he made the Fu Altar, using three victims to perform suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.

sentences.zh: 自未作鄜畤也，而雍旁故有吳陽武畤，雍東有好畤，皆廢無祠。

translations.literal: From not yet make Fu altar also, and Yong beside originally have Wu Yang Wu altar, Yong east have Hao altar, all abandoned no sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Since the Fu Altar was not yet made, beside Yong there originally were the Wu Yang Wu Altar and east of Yong the Hao Altar, all abandoned without sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「自古以雍州積高，神明之隩，故立畤郊上帝，諸神祠皆聚云。

translations.literal: Some say: 'From ancient with Yong province piled high, spirits bright recess, therefore establish altar suburban Supreme God, various spirits sacrifices all gather say.'
translations.idiomatic: Some say: 'Since ancient times Yong province has been piled high, a recess for the spirits and bright ones, therefore altars were established and suburban sacrifices made to the Supreme God, with sacrifices to all the various spirits gathering there.'

sentences.zh: 蓋黃帝時嘗用事，雖晚周亦郊焉。」

translations.literal: Probably Yellow Emperor time once perform affairs, though late Zhou also suburban there.'
translations.idiomatic: Probably in the Yellow Emperor's time this was once performed; even in the late Zhou they also performed suburban sacrifices there.'

sentences.zh: 其語不經見，縉紳者不道。

translations.literal: Its words not pass seen, noble scholars not speak.
translations.idiomatic: These words are not commonly seen; noble scholars do not speak of them.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後九年，文公獲若石雲，于陳倉北阪城祠之。

translations.literal: Make Fu altar after nine years, Wen Gong obtain like stone cloud, at Chen Cang north slope city sacrifice it.
translations.idiomatic: Nine years after making the Fu Altar, Wen Gong obtained something like a stone cloud, and at Chen Cang's northern slope he built a city to sacrifice to it.

sentences.zh: 其神或歲不至，或歲數來，來也常以夜，光輝若流星，從東南來集于祠城，則若雄雞，其聲殷雲，野雞夜雊。

translations.literal: Its spirit or year not arrive, or year several come, come also often with night, radiance like shooting star, from southeast come gather at sacrifice city, then like male chicken, its sound deep cloud, wild chickens night crow.
translations.idiomatic: Its spirit sometimes did not arrive for a year, sometimes came several times a year; when it came it was always at night, with radiance like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrifice city, sounding like a male chicken, its voice deep like thunder, with wild chickens crowing at night.

sentences.zh: 以一牢祠，命曰陳寶。

translations.literal: With one livestock set sacrifice, name say Chen Bao.
translations.idiomatic: Used one set of livestock to sacrifice, named it Chen Bao.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後七十八年，秦德公既立，卜居雍，「後子孫飲馬於河」，遂都雍。

translations.literal: Make Fu altar after seventy-eight years, Qin De Gong already established, divine dwell Yong, 'later descendants drink horses at river,' then capital Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Seventy-eight years after making the Fu Altar, Qin De Gong, having been established, divined dwelling in Yong, 'Later descendants will drink horses at the river,' and so made Yong the capital.

sentences.zh: 雍之諸祠自此興。

translations.literal: Yong's various sacrifices from this rise.
translations.idiomatic: Yong's various sacrifices began from this.

sentences.zh: 用三百牢於鄜畤。

translations.literal: Use three hundred livestock sets at Fu altar.
translations.idiomatic: Used three hundred sets of livestock at the Fu Altar.

sentences.zh: 作伏祠。

translations.literal: Make Fu sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Made the Fu sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 磔狗邑四門，以御蠱菑。

translations.literal: Split dogs city four gates, to defend against gu disasters.
translations.idiomatic: Split dogs at the four gates of the city, to ward off gu disasters.

sentences.zh: 德公立二年卒。

translations.literal: De Gong established two years die.
translations.idiomatic: De Gong was established for two years and then died.

sentences.zh: 其後（六）［四］年，秦宣公作密畤於渭南，祭青帝。

translations.literal: Its after four years, Qin Xuan Gong make Mi altar at Wei south, sacrifice Qing Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Qin Xuan Gong made the Mi Altar south of the Wei, sacrificing to the Qing Emperor.

sentences.zh: 其後十四年，秦繆公立，病臥五日不寤；

translations.literal: Its after fourteen years, Qin Mu Gong established, ill lie five days not awake;
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen years later, Qin Mu Gong was established; he fell ill and lay unconscious for five days;

sentences.zh: 寤，乃言夢見上帝，上帝命繆公平晉亂。

translations.literal: Awake, then speak dream see Supreme God, Supreme God command Mu Gong pacify Jin disorder.
translations.idiomatic: When he awoke, he said he dreamed of seeing the Supreme God, who commanded Mu Gong to pacify the Jin disorder.

sentences.zh: 史書而記藏之府。

translations.literal: Scribe write and record store in treasury.
translations.idiomatic: The scribe wrote it down and recorded it, storing it in the treasury.

sentences.zh: 而後世皆曰秦繆公上天。

translations.literal: And later generations all say Qin Mu Gong ascended heaven.
translations.idiomatic: And later generations all said that Qin Mu Gong ascended to heaven.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公即位九年，齊桓公既霸，會諸侯於葵丘，而欲封禪。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong ascended position nine years, Qi Huan Gong already hegemon, assemble feudal lords at Kui Qiu, and wish feng shan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Mu Gong had been on the throne for nine years; Qi Huan Gong had already achieved hegemony and assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu, wishing to perform feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「古者封泰山禪梁父者七十二家，而夷吾所記者十有二焉。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong say: 'Ancient ones feng Tai Shan shan Liang Fu ones seventy-two families, and Yi Wu what recorded ones ten have two there.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong said: 'Of the ancient ones who performed feng on Tai Shan and shan on Liang Fu, there were seventy-two families, and of those that Yi Wu recorded, there are twelve.'

sentences.zh: 昔無懷氏封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Former Wu Huai clan feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: In the past, the Wu Huai clan performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 虙羲封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Fu Xi feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Fu Xi performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 神農封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Shen Nong feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Shen Nong performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 炎帝封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Yan Emperor feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan Emperor performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 黃帝封泰山，禪亭亭；

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor feng Tai Shan, shan Ting Ting;
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Ting Ting;

sentences.zh: 顓頊封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Zhuan Xu feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Zhuan Xu performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 帝嚳封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Emperor Ku feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Ku performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 堯封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Yao feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Yao performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 舜封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Shun feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Shun performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 禹封泰山，禪會稽；

translations.literal: Yu feng Tai Shan, shan Kui Ji;
translations.idiomatic: Yu performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Kui Ji;

sentences.zh: 湯封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Tang feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Tang performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 周成王封泰山，禪社首：皆受命然後得封禪。」

translations.literal: Zhou Cheng Wang feng Tai Shan, shan She Shou: all received mandate then obtain feng shan.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Cheng Wang performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on She Shou: all received the mandate before being able to perform feng and shan.'

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「寡人北伐山戎，過孤竹；

translations.literal: Huan Gong say: 'I north attack Shan Rong, pass Gu Zhu;
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong said: 'I attacked the Shan Rong to the north, passed Gu Zhu;

sentences.zh: 西伐大夏，涉流沙，束馬懸車，上卑耳之山；

translations.literal: West attack Da Xia, ford flowing sands, bind horses hang chariots, ascend Bei Er mountain;
translations.idiomatic: Attacked Da Xia to the west, forded the flowing sands, bound horses and hung chariots, ascended Bei Er Mountain;

sentences.zh: 南伐至召陵，登熊耳山以望江漢。

translations.literal: South attack arrive Zhao Ling, ascend Xiong Er mountain to look Jiang Han.
translations.idiomatic: Attacked south to Zhao Ling, ascended Xiong Er Mountain to gaze at the Jiang and Han.
